Don't worry momma, they'll most likely start you off by having you watch your diet and checking your levels throughout the day (once when you wake up and fasting,  the other three times during the day 2 hours after your meals). I definitely recommend the Chia seeds also.  ;)

I was diagnosed very early with gestational diabetes at 8 weeks, because of other underlining issues. I am now 28 weeks pregnant and have not had to go on medication or insulin due to diet and exercise control. Yes, it's an inconvenience to have to poke myself 4 times a day, but absolutely worth it to ensure I have a healthy pregnancy. It's been a complete lifestyle change as far as diet management, but a change that I should of made prior to getting pregnant.  I still eat whatever I feel or crave, but in moderation and I also add a lot of veggies and lean protein. I've only gained 5 pounds thus far. Good luck and just remember, it doesn't have to be a life sentence.
